name: Opensea Clone
description: I developed an NFT marketplace using HTML, CSS, Typescript, Next.js, Thirdweb, and Firebase. The marketplace, inspired by Opensea, was built to enhance my development skills and understanding of blockchain technology. To facilitate the marketplace's user accounts, I added Firebase SDK and enabled login with Metamask. This feature allows users to personalize their accounts and easily mint, sell, and buy NFTs. By utilizing my front-end development expertise, I was able to create an intuitive and visually appealing user interface. Overall, this project was a valuable learning experience and enabled me to enhance my skills as a developer.

name: Crypto Lottery
description: Using Typescript and React.js, I created a responsive Weather App to refine my API skills and explore advanced topics such as the parallax effect. I integrated the Openweather API and Suncalc to allow users to search for the weather in any city and watch the UI adapt to the local weather and time. Additionally, I added a custom background that changes based on the current weather and time of day. The app was built with HTML, CSS, and Next.js.

name: Weather App
description: I developed a responsive Weather App using HTML, CSS, Typescript, Next.js, Openweather API, and Suncalc. The app allows users to search for the weather of any city in the world and watch the user interface change based on the local weather and time. To enhance the user experience, I added the Openweather API to provide local weather information and created a custom background that changes based on the time and local weather.

name: Tiles
description: I created a memory game using HTML, CSS, Typescript, and React.js, which features a visually appealing custom animation of a star explosion. Additionally, I implemented a score screen that allows user data to be stored locally without requiring login. Overall, this project showcases my abilities in front-end development, and I am excited to continue building upon these skills in future projects.
